Keeping your Azure Local instances up-to-date is essential for ensuring security, performance, and access to the latest Azure innovations. In my latest video, I walk you through **how to manage and update [Azure Local](https://www.thomasmaurer.ch/tag/azure-local/) instances directly from the Azure Portal**, making it easier than ever to maintain your hybrid cloud environment.

You‚Äôll learn how Azure Local updates work, how to monitor update status, and how to apply updates to keep your environment running smoothly‚Äîall from a single, unified interface.

üé• **Watch the full video:** *[Manage Azure Local Updates](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OwbWSiW-a5I)*

## üí° What You‚Äôll Learn

### 1. How to Update Azure Local Instances from the Azure Portal

Azure Local makes it simple to manage your on-premises Azure resources. In the video, I show you how to initiate and monitor updates directly from the Azure Portal. This process ensures that your infrastructure stays current with the latest features, patches, and performance improvements‚Äîwithout leaving the familiar Azure interface.

### 2. Solution Builder Extension Updates

I also cover **Solution Builder Extension Updates**, which are designed to enhance your Azure Local environment with new capabilities and improvements. Understanding how these updates work‚Äîand how to manage them‚Äîis key to keeping your Azure Local solutions optimized and secure.

### 3. Best Practices for Managing Updates for Azure Local

Finally, I share a few best practices for keeping your Azure Local environment healthy, including update scheduling, monitoring tools, and version control. These tips will help ensure smooth operations and minimize downtime during the update process.

## üöÄ Why It Matters

Azure Local bridges the gap between on-premises environments and Azure cloud services. By keeping your Azure Local instances updated, you ensure your hybrid infrastructure benefits from the **latest Azure capabilities, improved security posture, and consistent management experience**.

Whether you‚Äôre running Azure Local for edge computing, disconnected environments, or compliance reasons, mastering the update process is a key part of maintaining a healthy, secure, and efficient deployment.
